name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl is a trimesic acid derivative with three phenyl rings connected by single bonds. To estimate the melting point, we can start with the melting point of benzene (5.5°C) and consider the effect of the additional phenyl rings. Each phenyl ring can contribute around +30 to +50°C due to increased π-π interactions and molecular rigidity. The presence of three phenyl rings in 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl would lead to a significant increase in the melting point compared to benzene.
